##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite’s Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite’s Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying “hello” and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We’ve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you’d like.
Here’s a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html

FreeCodeCamp is very cool! I believe I will enjoy it. :smile:

Nice. That may be true, but I do want the good jobs or at least the chance to get them.
JJ should be read as Js Javascript

Cool! I am not in taipei right now but I will be next year. I think that if you finish this program and do the projects you won't need to go to a bootcamp except in the case of specializations like a JJ bootcamp or a. Net bootcamp.  I did research them for over a year (EEUU bootcamps) and they offer no much more than free bootcamp and the prices are ridiculously high.

Well let me introduce myself. My name is Jonathan. I am in Taichung. I have been learning how to computer program for over a year, but it's been more serious the last few months. I am a teacher in Taiwan and I teach my students programming as well, mostly khan academy and code.org. My goal is to attend a coding bootcamp after I finish this program and advance my skills, then get a job in the programming field. If anyone would like to chat and talk about programming or even just chat, send me a message. 你好我是喬納森。我現在住在台中。我一年多學電腦工程師。可是只有最近更認真學。如果想要談談請跟我聯絡。
